meanings.definition: A person who gives orders or instructions.
meanings.sent1: The commender told everyone to line up for the activity.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is the commender in the classroom, guiding the students.
meanings.sent3: The commender asked the class to do jumping jacks for homework, which made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: As the commender of the ship, Captain Smith steered through the storm with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The commender's voice echoed through the hallways, commanding attention from all.

meanings.sent1: Please commender the team to start working on the project immediately.
meanings.sent2: The coach will commender the players to focus on defense during practice.
meanings.sent3: I commendered my dog to fetch the ball, but he brought back a sock instead!
meanings.sent4: The CEO commendered the employees to meet the deadline, pushing them to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The general commendered his troops to charge forward, leading them into battle.

meanings.definition: To entrust or give responsibility to someone.
meanings.sent1: I commender my sister to take care of my plants while I'm away.
meanings.sent2: The manager commendered the new intern with an important project.
meanings.sent3: She commendered her best friend to keep her secret, but it somehow got out.
meanings.sent4: The professor commendered the students to conduct their own research for the assignment.
meanings.sent5: The king commendered his loyal knight to protect the kingdom from any threats.
